meanings.definition: Of or relating to the refraction of light
meanings.sent1: The dioptric properties of the lens helped focus the light.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the dioptric effects of the prism on the light.
meanings.sent3: The dioptric nature of the glass made the room look distorted.
meanings.sent4: Her dioptric vision of the world was clear and precise.
meanings.sent5: The dioptric quality of the telescope made distant stars appear closer.

meanings.definition: A lens or system of lenses for forming an image at a distance
meanings.sent1: He used a dioptric to capture the beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the dioptric to focus on the subject.
meanings.sent3: The dioptric in the camera helped capture the moment perfectly.
meanings.sent4: Her eyesight was like a dioptric, bringing faraway objects into focus.
meanings.sent5: The dioptric in the binoculars made the birds appear closer than they were.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement of the refractive power of a lens
meanings.sent1: The optometrist measured the lens using a dioptric.
meanings.sent2: She needed a new pair of glasses with a higher dioptric.
meanings.sent3: The dioptric value of the lens determined its strength.
meanings.sent4: His vision improved after getting glasses with the right dioptric.
meanings.sent5: The dioptric scale helped determine the correct prescription for the patient.
